revised_title: A Detailed Account of the 1783 Italian Earthquakes and Their Aftermath
tldr: In 1783, a series of earthquakes struck Italy, causing widespread damage and loss of life. Sir William Hamilton documented the events, damage, and aftermath of these earthquakes, including the destruction of towns, changes in the landscape, and the alteration of rivers and springs. The total mortality from the earthquakes was estimated to be around 40,000 people.
